content: Hi there! I wrote up an RFC for linting on unhandled variants/fields in non-exhaustive types. Please have a look, would love feedback on it: https://github.com/sunshowers/rfcs/blob/unknown-non-exhaustive/text/0000-unknown-non-exhaustive.md

i don't think new lints generally need an rfc but now that you've written it, it seems good enough to be worth submitting. only nits are around the name which isnt critical and can be discussed during the rfc process.

Thanks @Thom Chiovoloni. BTW you have a non-twitter reference for https://twitter.com/at_tcsc/status/1427728343584043008 ? would love to provide a more permanent link

@sunshowers6 @rustlang this is why some enums in rusqlite aren't non_exhaustive got reports from users that they want to get a compile-error when new variants are added, and i kinda just accepted that it would probably never reach 1.0 if this lint existed, those users could just do #[deny(...)] tho

- thom, supposedly (@at_tcsc)
FWIW I did feel like there were enough considerations here to warrant an RFC, but I could be wrong
https://github.com/rusqlite/rusqlite/issues/783 is the issue i'm referring to.
